examples.name: grid-basic
grid-spanning-columns
examples.content:
export const GridSpanningColumns = () => {
  return (
    <Grid
      h="200px"
      templateRows="repeat(2, 1fr)"
      templateColumns="repeat(5, 1fr)"
      gap={4}
    >
      <GridItem rowSpan={2} colSpan={1}>
        <Box>rowSpan=2</Box>
      </GridItem>
      <GridItem colSpan={2}>
        <Box>colSpan=2</Box>
      </GridItem>
      <GridItem colSpan={2}>
        <Box>colSpan=2</Box>
      </GridItem>
      <GridItem colSpan={4}>
        <Box>colSpan=4</Box>
      </GridItem>
    </Grid>
  )
}

examples.name: grid-with-col-span
examples.content:
export const GridWithColSpan = () => {
  return (
    <Grid templateColumns="repeat(4, 1fr)" gap="6">
      <GridItem colSpan={2}>
        <Box h="20" />
      </GridItem>
      <GridItem colSpan={1}>
        <Box h="20" />
      </GridItem>
      <GridItem colSpan={1}>
        <Box h="20" />
      </GridItem>
    </Grid>
  )
}

examples.name: grid-with-template-areas
examples.content:
export const GridWithTemplateAreas = () => {
  return (
    <Grid
      gap="4"
      templateAreas={`
      "one one two three"
      "four five five three"
    `}
    >
      <GridItem bg="green.500" area="one">
        <Box minH="20">one</Box>
      </GridItem>
      <GridItem bg="pink.500" area="two">
        <Box minH="20">two</Box>
      </GridItem>
      <GridItem bg="red.500" area="three">
        <Box minH="20">three</Box>
      </GridItem>
      <GridItem bg="teal.500" area="four">
        <Box minH="20">four</Box>
      </GridItem>
      <GridItem bg="yellow.500" area="five">
        <Box minH="20">five</Box>
      </GridItem>
    </Grid>
  )
}
